forums.20004416: Customizing and extending your help desk

entries.title: Users can belong to multiple Organizations
entries.body: I would like for anyone, even those that are not Agents, to be able to belong to multiple organizations.  This would allow me to (at a minimum) assign members of certain organizations, such as Creative, Sales, Production, etc., to a Disaster Recovery organization.  Then, I could give them access to a Disaster Recovery Forum, which contains more sensitive discussions and resources.

entries.title: Allow ability to reopen closed ticket
entries.body: There are times that a closed ticket needs to be reopened and reevaluated. There should be a way to do this in Zendesk. I'm sure it's just a matter of updating 1 field in your database for that ticket's record.

entries.title: Ignore non-working days for time-based rules
entries.body:
It would be really useful if you could choose to define days as "non-working" that would not count as elapsed time for SLAs, automations, etc.

e.g. You set Saturday and Sunday as your non-working days, and you have an SLA saying issues should be solved within 72 hours.

An issue reported Friday morning would then not be flagged as threatening this SLA until Wednesday, rather than Monday.

entries.title: Rating Support
entries.body: I would love to see a review/rating system for tickets.  Requester would be prompted to review both the resolution and the agent that assisted with the ticket.  Help Desk owners could view agents rating via Reports.

entries.title: Google Apps integration
entries.body:
Especially with Zendesk being a popular listing on the Google Marketplace, we've heard a lot of customer feedback about integration with Google Apps.  The most popular request has been Google OpenID integration, which is on our roadmap.  In addition to implementing Google OpenID, we'd like to give our customers the opportunity to help define a compelling and seamless workflow that brings the Zendesk experience into Google Apps.  Current features under consideration for the roadmap are:

  • Single sign-on:  Login to Zendesk with Google OpenID.
  • Agent on-boarding:  On-board users from your Google Apps domain as agents.
  • Universal navigation:  One-click access to Zendesk from the Google Apps navigation bar.
  • Calendar integration:  View outstanding Zendesk tasks on your Google Calendar.
  • Document sharing:  Access and share your Google Docs when creating or updating a ticket.
  • Gadget integration:  Embed important Zendesk data into iGoogle or as Google Apps contextual gadgets.

What will improve your experience and enable you to better support your customers through Google Apps and Zendesk?  We invite you to share your ideas!

entries.title: Find duplicate users and merge
entries.body: It'd be really impressive if Zendesk let us find duplicate users and automate merging them.  Gmail just did this and it made cleaning my address book a breeze.

entries.title: Custom fields per Group
entries.body:
I have several departments that use the helpdesk. For example, a customer service group, and an HR group. The HR group receives CVs for applicants send to jobs@mysite.zendesk.com, while the customer service group manages customer inquiries received via support@mysite.zendesk.com


Obviously the Status field such as Open, Pending, and Closed are useful for both groups. But the HR group needs specific fields such as "Applications", with options such as in review, approved, rejected, and so on.

Hence, it will be very useful to be able to customize views so that each group has their own set of specific custom fields whcih they can use to categorize messages.

entries.title: Multiple Front-Ends and Reply-To Addresses
entries.body:
I manage a web development firm who services both clients and creates/hosts web applications.  We love Zendesk, but we'd love to be able to deliver branded customer support without buying multiple accounts.  We're not looking to outsource or resell your product; we (leveltwo, inc.) would be handling support requests.  But when we send responses and receive requests, we'd like to be able to do so with customized domains (multiple, not just one).

For instance, say we serviced Company A and Company B, and Application 1.  Customers of Company A should be able to send support requests to support@companyA.com, and receive responses from support@companyA.com.  Likewise with Company B and Application 1.  Unfortunately as it stands right now, while some creativity with triggers and some DNS records would allow us to assign groups to tickets using the addresses that the support requests were sent to, when we reply it's going to say support@level2designs.com for any of the tickets.

This would be a great feature, and would be wonderful especially for companies like web dev. companies who service multiple customers.

To clarify again, we would not be reselling your services, just managing our support through your service, but to multiple clients.

entries.title: More User Data
entries.body: I think you need to allow the administer the ability to add user data fields.  Examples would be, Address, Website, Skype Profile, IM Profile etc.

entries.title: Conditional custom fields
entries.body: It would be great to be able to configure ticket fields such that they appear/disappear based on the value of another ticket field. For example, if I set the field "Purpose" to "Media Request", I could display a set of fields relevant to media requests, whereas if "Purpose" were set to "Office Supplies", I could display a set of fields relevant to office supplies.

entries.title: "Add CC" as trigger / automation action
entries.body:
Desired functionality: a way to automatically add a CC to tickets that match a certain condition.

Example: Trigger if Organization is "Acme Co" and Priority is more than Normal, then "Add CC" - specifying an end-user email address.  This would allow the organization's primary contact stay in the loop about what their employees have requested.

Workaround: use a notify target "email" type to send emails to the person who needs to be CC'd.

entries.title: Facebook tab integration
entries.body: It would be great if Zendesk could appear in a tab on our fan page so fans could make a support request right there in a "Help" tab.

entries.title: Replicating your config on your sandbox
entries.body:
It would be great to be able to replicate your environment in your sandbox. There is an export facility in the prod box, but there is no Import facility. Having a sandbox that doesn't mirror your prod box is pretty much useless, and having to redo all the config manually on the sandbox is extremely time consuming!!!

This is the first thing that any customer with a sandbox will be asking for.... and I'm probably not the first one!

entries.title: Agent Auto Signature
entries.body: Just a simple addition to consider adding at some point.  It would be nice if agents could set their signature in their profile.  It gets old typing (thanks, Andrew) over & over.  If you could put that in your profile it would just be automatically added at the end of every ticket post.

entries.title: Formatted text in Tickets, not forum
entries.body:
Hi,

Not sure how hard this is to do, but it would be really nice, is to have emails submitted as tickets to keep the color that was submitted.

Reason is my clients submit html/outlook rich text which shows red or other colors of things they want changed or updated, just to be clear. However, once inside the ticket, I don't see any color at all. (Luckily, from the server side, I get a CC of all originals at another mailbox so I can see what they really submitted originally, with the crossed-out text, colors, etc.)

In a related feature request, it would be nice to be able to put [code]...[/code] and just have it marked as code in the ticket and in the forums.

Thanks! You have a great product here!

entries.title: Changing a public comment to private and vice-versa
entries.body: I would like the ability (as an admin) to change agent’s comments from private to public or public to private, after a comment has been posted.

entries.title: Adding Custom Fields to User/Organization IDs
entries.body:
We would like the ability to distinguish between different types of customers (e.g., Paid vs. Trial users, which product they are using etc.). It would be a huge asset to have custom fields added to user and organization IDs to enter additional details such as this. This would help us to identify who is responsible for what accounts.

Cheers,

entries.title: "Mark as spam" feature
entries.body: I'd love a "mark ticket as spam" feature that would not only delete the ticket, but also delete the associated user account that's created automatically.

entries.title: Enable End Users to be able to Edit their own Comments, Updates, or Initial Requests
entries.body:
Need the ability to edit existing comments in the ticket thread

often typo's or other simple mistakes are made that need to be corrected

this is espcially relevant if a public comment is posted by mistake that has information that is not appropriate for the end user to see

 

Im sure we all run into this as good as our Agents are

Tiago Soromenho had a similar request embeded in his thread but just for the initial request

every comment/update/request should be editable by an agent


furthermore end-users/clients should also be able to edit their own initial requests/comments/updates

they make mistakes too!

 

thanks

 

All in all pretty happy with the interface so far!!

entries.title: Auto suggest forum topics
entries.body: When user's submit requests, I'd love it if Zendesk would automatically suggest forum topics. This could be based on the auto-tagging feature so that if a new request is automatically tagged, forums tagged with the same tags would be suggested to the user before the case was submitted. As the body of content grows in the forums, fewer and fewer support requests will require direct support staff involvement.

entries.title: Creating tickets from HTML emails
entries.body:
I work for an email marketing company called dotMailer and we have just started trialling Zendesk with the hope that we can use it to run our support system.

Because we are an email marketing company most of our support is based around problems with HTML emails. Clients will often forward their HTML newsletter to our support email address along with a request for help. Unfortunately Zendesk doesn’t seem able to preserve the HTML email when a ticket is created, instead it strips the text from the email and creates a plain text type ticket. This is a problem for the support team because they cannot see the email as the client would be.

Would it be possible for Zendesk to attach the HTML document from an email to a ticket?

entries.title: Changing the order of pinned topics
entries.body:
I'm creating this feature request on behalf of Stefano Bertacchi.

It would be good if I could choose which order pinned articles appeared on the homepage instead of them only being displayed in order of topic creation date.

It would also be good if I could choose how many topics should be shown on the homepage at any one time - right now it is limited to 5 and I want to show 6 topics on the homepage at once without needing to go to the next page.

entries.title: Notifications for suspended tickets
entries.body:
Please add a method (trigger?) to allow email notifications to be send out for tickets/incoming emails that get flagged as "suspended".   

 

Thank You!

entries.title: Dropbox in ANY language.
entries.body: We need to be able to translate the whole dropbox into Czech. Untill then, Zendesk is useless for our company.

entries.title: See who's subscribed to a forum or post?
entries.body:
Is it possible to see a list of users who have subscribed to a particular forum or post?

I'd like to see who's going to get notifications before I post, just out of interest.

If not, can we have this?

Thanks, Alan.

entries.title: New Ticket, Forums & API features! Oh my!
entries.body:
This week it just so happens we've got lots of small, but very very cool, features rolling out, designed especially for you.

1. Suspended Ticket Notifications

Admins can now set up digest emails about tickets that have recently been suspended. 

It's super simple to set up, just go to Settings > Tickets and you'll see a section called "Suspended Ticket Notification"

From here, you can specify how often the digests should be dispatched. Note that if there are no suspended tickets, we're not going to send you a blank email every 10 minutes ;)

Once you're settled on a frequency, add the email addresses you would like to notify in the text area - separating them out by commas.

2. See your forum subscribers and voters

Agents, with moderator privileges, are now able to see who is subscribed to a forum or a topic. 

As well as being able to see who voted.

Simply click on the numbers, and you'll be shown a detailed list of who subscribed or voted.

3. Agents can select to tweet a Twicket URL on-demand

Previously, only Admins could make the choice of including a Twicket URL in outgoing Tweets or not - so Agents never had the choice. 

To let your Agents choose whether to include the Twicket URL in outgoing Tweets or not, simply go to Settings > Channels > Twitter and uncheck the following option in the "General settings" tab:

Now, your agents can choose ad-hoc when they want to include the URL:

4. Admins can now change a public comment to private

So you've made a big mistake and accidentally put something into a public comment which you shouldn't have. But, you don't want to ruin your audit trail by deleting the ticket, right? 

Admins can now change public comments to private, to cover up life's little blunders. 

Note that due to the sensitive nature of this, there's a few restrictions

  1. This is an irreversible process. Once a public comment is made private, it may not be switched back.
  2. The email notifications that went out will remain as such, it's not possible for us to "undo" sent emails. 
  3. Private comments may not be made into Public comments. 

So, use with a little bit of caution.

5. Say hello to Gravatar

Gravatar is a cool little service which hosts your profile image for you. When you upload a profile image, you tie it to your email address. This means that if you give someone like Zendesk an email address, we can ask Gravatar if they hold a profile image for that email address.

If they do, we'll display the profile image Gravatar gave back to us. You and your customers don't need to lift a finger to make this happen. If a profile image was upload through Zendesk, we'll use that rather than Gravatar. 

6. Prettier layouts

We’ve also been working on improving parts of our interface yet again. Most notable is the styling changes to editing profiles. You’ll notice that it’s now more in-line with our other settings pages, and nicely splits out into manageable tabs.

Second, our views have seen a small enhancements to keep them looking nice and modern. 

As well as this, we've improved how <pre> and <code> markup renders in forum topics.

7. Other New Stuff

  • Profile pictures may now be included in API calls when creating or editing users. Just pass in remote_photo_url with a publicly accessible URL, and Zendesk will suck it in and save it as that users profile image. For example: 
    POST /users.xml

<user>
  <email>aljohson@yourcompany.dk</email>
  <name>Al Johnson</name>
  <remote-photo-url>http://www.example.com/photo/me.png </remote-photo-url>
  <roles>4</roles>
  <restriction-id>1</restriction-id>
  <groups type='array'>
    <group>2</group>
    <group>3</group>
  </groups>
</user>
  • Profile pictures may also be set via Remote Authentication. Be sure to pass back remote_photo_url as a URL parameter, and include it in your hash if you do include a URL.
  • Requester names may now be set via the Mail API using {{requester:jake@zendesk.com requester_name:"Jake Holman"}} for example.
  • Closed tickets can now be added to forums, just like open tickets can.
  • Agents can use Zendesk placeholders in all ticket interfaces. This was previously only possible when doing bulk update. With this change, you can insert a placeholder and it will be resolved after the ticket form is saved. Useful for things like responding to a problem ticket and having the requester names replaced in the linked incidents.
  • We've fully documented how we support the "Liquid" API so you can fully customize just about anything you want: https://support.zendesk.com/entries/20134837-using-liquid-markup-to-customize-comments-and-email-notifications

We really hope you enjoy all of these awesome updates! We'll keep them coming and look forward to your feedback.

entries.title: New ticket header, SEO improvements and fixed stuff
entries.body:
New Stuff

  • The ticket header is gone through a few small tweaks in its layout. Not much has changed here other than positions.
     
  • For all you SEO fans, we've now added a "canonical" reference to forum topics when visitors hit an old URL. This typically happens if you change the name of a topic, but have it linked elsewhere or visitors have it bookmarked. This will tell search engines which URL is the preferred URL, thus reducing the problem of duplicate content.
  • Widgets can now have a "Show to non-logged in users" option. This means you now have more control over who has visibility over your widgets.
  • MindTouch, an excellent social knowledge base app, is now integrated into Zendesk. You can find out more on our blog, and get your free MindTouch license.

Fixed Stuff

  • We now better handle the decoding of Chinese characters in emails.
  • When auto-linking URLs, we would sometimes double-escape ampersands. This no longer happens.
  • We now allow foo..bar@example.com email addresses, for those naughty mail servers that allow their creation!
  • Views that are sorted by a custom field which is a number, we'll now sort correctly by integer value. This means decimal numbers are no longer sorted incorrectly.
  • End-users attempting to rate closed tickets are now presented with an error page rather than a green screen.

entries.title: Two awesome integrations and fixed stuff
entries.body:
New Stuff

  • ifbyphone has been added as a new integration, for more details see the ifbyphone website.
  • Turn live chat transcripts into tickets automagically with Olark, more details from their blog post
  • New settings layout has been applied to editing of forums, categories, ticket fields, group and organization pages.

Fixed Stuff

  • TinyMCE (our editor for forums) was previously showing different styling in the editor to what would actually appear on the page. We've now matched these stylings up.
  • Welcome emails containing verification links were confusing end-users. When clicking on the verification link end-users should have been logged in. This is now fixed.
  • From the tag management page, clicking on a tag which had punctuation would cause an error in Zendesk (clicking on foo.bar for example). This is now resolved.
  • Zendesk chat sound notifications weren't being played by some browsers, or causing strange behaviour. This should no longer be happening.
  • When an end-user tries to access a ticket they do not have access to, the error message was shown in English. We've now made this string translatable.

entries.title: Password internationalisation & fixed stuff
entries.body:
New Stuff

  • Creating or Editing Widgets and Targets have now been updated to our new settings UI.
  • Password pages are now internationalised for end-users.

Fixed Stuff

  • It was previously possible to accidentally solve a ticket without a required custom field. It is no longer possible to do this.
  • Using some unicode characters (Japanese, for example) while searching for people would occasionally cause Zendesk to error. This is now resolved.
  • When setting case-sensitive URLs in the Settings > Accounts > Branding page, Zendesk was downcasing all URLs entered. Zendesk will no longer do this.
  • Zendesk would attempt do double "escape" some characters (such as < > etc) in Report titles. We'll no longer do this.
  • entries.rss had invalid XML content causing errors in some RSS readers. We've fixed the XML.
  • Comment ordering on Android browsers were incorrect. This is now resolved.
  • Editing rules UI (Triggers, Automations, Macros) was broken in Internet Explorer. This is now fixed.

entries.title: A few additional UI improvements & fixed stuff
entries.body:
New Stuff

  • The creation/edit pages of Macros, Triggers, Automations and Views have been updated to reflect our new settings user interface.

Fixed Stuff

  • During the password creation process for those accounts on a high security setting, if the customer submitted a password that did not match against a high security requirement, the dynamic check on subsequent attempts would not operate correctly. Note this does not mean customers were able to create weak passwords.
  • In a very small amount of cases, some users were unable to change their profile pictures. This is now resolved.

entries.title: Problem/Incident linking & fixed stuff
entries.body:
New Stuff

  • When an agent solves a problem ticket, we'll make sure that linked incidents are set to the same group and assignee as the problem ticket, but only in the event that the linked incidents do not have a group or assignee. This means that there will not longer be the case of incidents floating around suddenly unassigned, after the problem has beeen solved.

Fixed Stuff

  • Attaching a file, then removing it, then trying to re-attach that same file used to result in the upload failing. This no longer happens.
  • "Open tickets in your group", which appears for agent and admins on the /home page, was linking to a search that showed incorrect results in some cases. This is now resolved.
  • Last week we had a problem with the order of comments being incorrectly sorted. That was resolved.
  • The table view tooltip should no longer render outside of the browser window in most cases.
  • When an end-user marks a problem ticket as solved, we will not try and solve the linked incidents.

entries.title: All new interface designs, API authentication & Fixed Stuff
entries.body:
New Stuff

  • This week you'll see a huge improvement to the Zendesk settings interface. No more huge menus, long settings pages or ambiguous locations. You'll see better layouts, easier management and an overall more intuitive interface to work with. Check out the video for a preview of it all. This is the first in many steps we're taking in improving the interface.

    Here's a handy table telling you the contents of each menu for those of you used to the old "Account" menu.

    Settings Menu Item Contents
    Account
    • Branding
    • Languages & Times (Localization)
    • Account Address
    • Billing Invoices
    Security
    • Authentication (Remote Auth, SAML)
    • SSL
    • Password Policy
    Channels
    • Email Settings
    • Web Portal Settings
    • Twitter Settings
    • Chat Settings
    • Zendesk Dropbox
    • Zendesk API
    Tickets
    • General Ticket Settings including:
      • Comments
      • Attachments
      • Tags
    Agents
    • General Agent permissions including:
      • Ability to delete tickets
      • Forwarded Agent tickets
    End-Users
    • General End-user permissions including:
      • Welcome email template
      • CC email template
    Extensions
    • Widgets
    • Targets
    • Salesforce
  • You can now accept Twitter DMs on monitored Twitter accounts. This means DMs received can be turned directly into tickets. Remember, they must be following you in order to DM back! You'll find this under Settings > Channels > Twitter.
  • A new authentication method into the API has been opened up. Rather than using your email and password to access the Zendesk API, you can use an email and token combination. You'll find this under Settings > Channels > Zendesk API.

Fixed Stuff

  • When views or automations contained the condition [Hours since][(business hours) is] we would occasionally not match the correct number of tickets. This is now resolved.
  • Priority and Type, when the fields are set to be editable by end-users, was not transferring correctly if the ticket was suspended. This is now fixed.
  • Email addresses may no longer contain non-ASCII characters. 
  • A redirection loop could occasionally occur in remote authentication, where Zendesk would send a return_to paramter of the Zendesk login page. This should no longer occur.
  • In Internet Explorer 7, there was misalignment on the settings page to configure pinned topics on the home page. Alignment is now restored.

entries.title: Two huge security features this week
entries.body:
This week we have new things for you, two huge security features.

New Stuff

  • We've introduced new levels of password security, available to all Zendesk accounts. This allows you to enforce that both end-users and agents must have specific password combinations, or even have to refresh their password after a while. Current customers are not affected by this, so there is nothing you need to change, but to find out more check out: https://support.zendesk.com/entries/510058-new-password-security-settings-for-zendesk
  • SAML (Secure Assertion Markup Language) is an authentication method picking up popularity. It's similar in some ways to the Zendesk Remote Authentication, but is far more extensible particularly with identity methods such as Active Directory and LDAP. Find out more at https://support.zendesk.com/entries/514714-introducing-saml-for-zendesk

entries.title: Forum SEO improvements and a fix
entries.body:
New Stuff

  • We've made some improvements to forums which will hopefully increase Search Engine Optimization, leading to better ranking of your forums by search engines such as Google. This involves things like changing the meta description, page titles and keywords to values that Google understand better. 

Fixed Stuff

  • In some cases, opening live chat from the Zendesk dropbox would not close the Zendesk dropbox as intended, in many browsers. We've now resolve this but please note, some older browsers will not be able to successfully close the Zendesk dropbox.

entries.title: Closed tickets, signatures and fixed stuff
entries.body:
New Stuff

  • If a previously closed ticket is responded to via email (by either agent or end-user) the "source" of that ticket will now be set to "Closed ticket" rather than "Email". 
  • A change we previously made to agent signatures which involved excluding them from agent created new tickets has now been reverted due to popular demand. 
  • When agents navigate to a Group or Organization page, and that agent has restricted permissions, they will only see the tickets listed for which they have access to. 

Fixed Stuff

  • On the mobile friendly agent interface, personal macros were not being shown in the macro menu when creating new tickets.
  • When new end-users register for an account on your Zendesk, and have previously changed their language option, we were resetting that language on registration. This no longer happens, and instead we save the language they selected during registration to their profile. 
  • On the new settings pages, you were unable to select radio buttons and some checkboxes by clicking on their labels. This is standard good behaviour for usability, and has now been resolved.  
  • If you have host mapping set up, we will often redirect users from the non-mapped domain to your custom domain. When this happens, we sometimes lose the log in session during that redirect. This will no longer happen. 
  • Long, one word strings in topics will now be forced to wrap, so they don't "float" outside of their container. This means really long links can appear in topic without breaking anything. 
  • Using the Ctrl+S shortcut to Submit a ticket from the tags field is now possible. 
  • When using placeholders that rely on the requester's information, such as {{requester.name}}, in macro being applied to new tickets, the placeholder would not populate. This is no longer that case, so that using such macros in new tickets will correctly populate requester placeholders.

entries.title: A new Zendesk dropbox redesign, GoodData, CSS changes & fixed stuff
entries.body:
The Zendesk dropbox, only better

This week we're introducing a new design on the Zendesk dropbox, you can think of it as 2.1 - there's no new features, but it does look very different.

No more year 1999 look and feel

The new design brings with it a fresh new look, as well as some major tweaks and improvements to the overall user experience. We've reduced the use of harsh shades, no more sharp edges (Internet Explorer will still see this) and better separation of important user interface elements. 

A better user experience

From the Zendesk dropbox, your customers are able to search your knowledge base and community forums for answers they need. Presenting those search results in a readable way is important, but more so is the ability to take the next action if none of those results were helpful.

If you have "Topic Suggestion" turned on (which is used to try and give your customers knowledge base articles before they submit a ticket or start a live chat) then this experience has also been enhanced:

It's all the small things

As well as the above highlights, there's a few other changes too:

  • When the Zendesk dropbox is closed, re-opening will reset the Zendesk dropbox rather than re-opening on the page it was closed at. 
  • It's now much easier to navigate around the Zendesk dropbox, including being able to go back to previous steps. 
  • When Zendesk chat is turned on, customers will now be given the option to chat or submit a ticket right away. If chat is selected, we will at that point go off to check if there is an agent available to take the chat.

Getting started

If you're already using the Zendesk dropbox, you'll need to generate a new one. The previous versions are not overwritten by this new update.

If you've not used the Zendesk dropbox before, you can set one up as an Admin. Go to Account > Dropbox (under the "Apps" heading) and you're ready to go.

 

Other New Stuff

  • There is a new GoodData template available, for you to take advantage of the new extended metrics we launched recently. Learn more about GoodData.
  • We're currently beta testing a new SAML implementation, and we'd like your help. Be part of the beta.
  • The attachments interface for admins on a ticket has seen a small interface enhancement.
  • Domain mapping on organizations now fully supports separation of email addresses by space, comma or semi-colon.
  • The CSS changes to the sidebar are now live.

Fixed Stuff

  • When follow up tickets are created via email, the original requester will be used and not the person that makes the follow up.
  • Some CCs were being dropped from tickets, this was in very rare circumstances, but has now been fixed.
  • On occasion an organization's note was not editable, which is now resolved.
  • When bulk selecting tickets and applying a macro that removes tags, the tags would not actually be removed. This is now resolved.

entries.title: A few simple fixes this week
entries.body:
All this great stuff will be rolled out by 4:00pm PST / 7:00pm ET / 12:00am GMT today. There will be no downtime. 

Fixed Stuff

  • In some cases, the search results page was displaying a lower number of physical results than the number of results reported by the same UI. There should no longer be a mis-match in this UI.
  • The new, tabbed settings pages wasn't correctly selecting the correct tab when navigating from a hyperlink, such as /twitter/settings#manage_searches - this is now resolved.
  • In rare circumstances, some reports and CSV exports were no working as intended, or not updating when they should have been. This is now resolved.

entries.title: Interface improvements & fixed stuff
entries.body:
New Stuff

Here come the UI enhancements! This week we have only one new thing, and that's a huge update to our settings page interface (although it's 11 new things if you count all of them).

We try and keep the amount of settings in Zendesk to a minimum - but over time we've simply had to increase the number of settings due to enhancements or brand new features. We found that the settings were growing beyond the original interface of Zendesk, and as a result appeared a little messy and confusing. 

Now, all the settings pages have a unified, simple to read layout. There's a little sample below:

We're making a continued effort to bring the Zendesk interface up to date, and this is only the beginning. You'll begin seeing subtle improvements, designed to make life easier but not interrupt you, in the upcoming months. 

Fixed Stuff

  • Portugese "out of office" responses were making it through the filter which normally suspends such messages. We've resolved this by adding the correct phrases to our dictionary. If you find the same thing is happening to you in your language, let us know on support@zendesk.com
  • Some forms weren't behaving correctly when trying to tab through to complete them (skipping some input fields). This is now resolved.
  • IE6 was experiencing some problems with the agent view of a ticket, which was resolved. Note we don't normally support IE6 for the agent interface.

entries.title: Updates to managing your rules & fixed stuff
entries.body:
New Stuff

  • If you have more than two inactive Views, Triggers, Automations or Macros then you will now be able bulk delete these inactive rules. Note that the deletion is permanent, so wield your new powers with care.
  • You may notice that when navigating to the Ticket Options page, the interface is different from other settings pages in Zendesk. It will be rolled out across all settings pages soon.
  • Admins are now able to choose whether or not attachments can be accessed by end-users without needing to sign in to your Zendesk account. Note that turning authentication for attachments on may increase the difficulty in accessing attachments for you end-users significantly. 

Fixed Stuff

  • When testing a URL shortener to use when making Twickets, Internet Explorer was having problems and redirecting to a blank page. This is now resolved.
  • A small spelling mistake was identified when merging users, which has now been corrected.
  • Some minor speed enhancements were made to the forums area, particularly around topics and their comments.

entries.title: Updates to Twitter, Business Hours, Metrics and lots of Fixed Stuff
entries.body:
New Stuff

  • The Twitter icon on the interface will now glow blue when there are new results for a saved search set up in Zendesk. Note this will be rolled out to all customer over the coming weeks. (Learn More)
  • You're now able to automatically convert @mentions of monitored Twitter accounts. (Learn More)
  • We've expanded the choice of URL shorteners to be used, including bit.ly custom domains or even your very own custom URL shortener. (Learn More)
  • Plus+ customers may now take advantage of business hours, extending functionality of rules, SLAs and reports. (Learn More)
  • Plus+ customers also have access to new ticket metrics available, which include being able to see the number of interactions, wait time for your customers and how long it really took to solve a ticket - again, all these can be taken advantage of in rules, reports, views and GoodData. (Learn More)

Fixed Stuff

  • There are a number of widgets that have been set to be visible to agents only and these are: LogMeIn Rescue, Harvest, Highrise, Salesforce, FreshBooks, JIRA, ScreenSteps Live, ScreenSteps Live Tasks, Tactile CRM, BatchBook, GoToManage, Contactology and Clarizen. We apologise if this is of inconvenience and you actually did mean to display these widgets to end-users, you can simply edit these widgets to put them back into the view of End-Users.
  • Zendesk was occasionally not resizing profile images, which resulted in a mixture of large and small profile pictures all of the place. This has now been resolved. 
  • When using the Search API to find a ticket by ID, we weren't honoring the requested return format of XML or JSON, this is now fixed.
  • Those accounts with a large number of agents and the agent assignee auto-complete were seeing edge-problems in Firefox and Internet Explorer which should now be resolved.
  • The Zendesk dropbox validation was a little too harsh on when validation was performed. We've pulled this back a little so the flow of completing a submission form is no longer as intrusive. 
  • A drop-down custom fields in the Zendesk dropbox was bypassing required validation, which should no longer happen.
  • Zendesk chat was negatively affected by a change made for SSL within the Zendesk dropbox. This change was reverted and chat was fixed during the week.
  • Occasionally the Pivotal Tracker Target would fail to get tickets to Pivotal. This is now fixed.
  • Posts.rss (the Forums RSS Feed) contained invalid RSS. We've now fixed this, which should mean more RSS readers will now work nicely with Zendesk.
  • If the CSV exporter fails due to a timeout, we'll keep trying for an extended period of time.
  • The JSON return for an entry was missing the created_at attribute from comments listed, we've now added this.
  • Outlook 97 (people still use it!) styled links in a way that caused Zendesk to occasionally strip them from incoming emails. We've now fixed that issue.
  • In very rare cases, two agents recovering the same ticket at exactly the same time from the suspended queue would actually create two tickets. This should no longer be possible.

entries.title: A few fixed things for the week
entries.body:
This week, I only have a few bug fixes to show you. Whenever we release weekly updates made up of more fixes than new stuff, it’s because the new stuff is actively being worked on but simply isn’t ready for release yet.

Fixed Stuff

  • In Internet Explorer, the modal window for merging tickets wasn't displaying correctly. This has now been fixed.
  • Some HTML code was incorrectly displaying in error messages, which should no longer be the case
  • In some cases, trying to access the JSON representation of a ticket was failing, which is no resolved.
  • Finally, Agent signatures will no longer be added to new tickets that have been created by an agent, and where the requester is someone other than that agent - or when the ticket is created via the API by an agent under the same conditions. This will avoid scenarios where agents raise tickets on behalf of your customers, but that agent’s signature is appended to what appears

Security Patch

Zendesk was made aware of a possible security exploit that could occur in rare circumstances. Only one customer was impacted and the issue was corrected within the hour. This issue was related to incorrect use of the x-on-behalf of API and was not part of the standard Zendesk web user interface. At Zendesk, we take security very seriously. We have also reviewed our log files to confirm that there has been no other incorrect use of this API. Thank you to the individual who brought this matter to our attention.

entries.title: Adding CC in triggers/automations & fixed stuff
entries.body:
New Stuff

  • You are now able to manually set an end-user's language from their profile page. 
  • You may now add agents to the CC list automatically using Triggers and Automations. At the moment, this is just limited to adding agents. 

Fixed Stuff

  • Some forms inside our lightbox / dialog popups weren't behaving themselves in Internet Explorer 8. Those dialogs have now been tamed. 
  • In Internet Explorer, when the agent collision notification appears on the screen informing other agents that the ticket has been changed since they started viewing it, the "reload" link was not working correctly. This has now been fixed.

entries.title: Updates to End-User interface, Twitter & fixed stuff
entries.body:
New Stuff

  • End-users are now able to select if they would like to see a detailed (list) or compact (table) view of their currently open tickets. This should make it easier for those end-users with a large amount of open tickets to easily see all of their tickets with minimal scroll. 
  • This week we've made a small backend enhancement to how Twitter conversations are captured on twickets, using Twitter's built-in conversation threading abilities. Agents should notice that this will lead to more relevant tweets being captured on a Twicket.
  • You are now able to specify the "setDomainName" parameter in Google Analytics, very useful for those of you with domain mapping that want Google to understand that the Zendesk domain is the same as your own domain. More information can be found at Google
  • There is a CSS change this week. All sidebar (widget) .side-box-content h4 will become .side-box-content h5, and .side-box-content h4.white will become simply .side-box-content h4

Fixed Stuff

  • The agent mini-dashboard should have been displaying new, as well as open, tickets assigned to your groups - but this wasn't the case. This has now been fixed.
  • When telling Zendesk not to allow end-users to attach files via the web interface, Zendesk was ignoring this option. Now, Zendesk will only show attachment options to end-users when that this option is turned on by Admins.
  • Previously, it was possible to add in the default reply address of the Zendesk account to a user's identities. This wasn't supposed to be allowed, due to the various looping problems it would cause. This is once again no longer possible. 
  • In rare cases, the organization of an end-user was not being recognized on tickets. As a result, some tickets were created with no organization, despite the end-user having an organization at the point of ticket creation. This is now resolved.

entries.title: A small interface change & fixed stuff
entries.body:
Over the holiday period, we'll be releasing regularly on Wednesday rather than our usual Thursday.

New Stuff

  • We've made a small change to our views and macros management interface to make way for an improvement to our settings pages in the weeks to come. You'll now find shared and personal views/macros under different headings.
     
  • When an end-user opens a chat from the Zendesk dropbox, the Zendesk dropbox will close rather than remaining open. Note, this may not work on some browsers such as older versions of Internet Explorer.

Fixed Stuff

  • Various internet explorer error fixes caused by the Zendesk dropbox. 
  • "View available placeholders" link on rules pages had a strange border around it, we removed the strangeness. 
  • Subjects on emails that were written in Hebrew were being truncated, this should no longer happen.

entries.title: User merge, Salesforce, requester widget, Zendesk dropbox, workflow improvements and fixed stuff
entries.body:
User Merge!

It's been on our radar for a while, but it's finally here! Agents are now able to merge users together.

There are two important things to understand when considering user merge. There is always one winner, and one loser. The winner is the profile being merged into, which means it will inherit all of the loser's tickets, topics and communication channel such as email addresses and twitter names. 

You should check out the video for a demo of how this works.

Note: This is only enabled for accounts without remote authentication. Remote authentication accounts pose a lot of complexity because users need to be in sync, and if we start merging users on the Zendesk side, it can mess things up.

Other New Stuff

  • We've made a major enhancements to our Salesforce Inegration which brings bucket loads of new features. To find out how to get started with Zendesk for Salesforce, check out product manager, Steven Yan's post: https://support.zendesk.com/entries/348914-introducing-zendesk-for-salesforce
  • We've updated the ticket merging interface to be more informative and less text heavy. You'll now find it much easier to use.
  • The "Requester Widget", which contains all information about a requester will now appear dynamically when creating new tickets. When you're editing the requester on a ticket, the widget will now update with the latest requester dynamically, too.
  • If you display custom fields in the Zendesk dropbox, it will now include the description you have given that custom fields as a placeholder on the Zendesk dropbox. 
  • If you come to a ticket from a specific view, you are now able to "Update ticket and go to next". This is particularly useful if you're always working from one particular view and want to simply work through all of those tickets. You can also use the keyboard shortcut Ctrl+Shift+S in order to submit the current ticket and move on to the next.

Fixed Stuff

  • Unverified emails addresses were unable to be deleted from profiles. This is now resolved.
  • We've made changes to the way in which our suspended tickets behave. This means that, when using the "Automatically recover as..." option while recovering individual or bulk tickets, Zendesk will behave better with suspended emails that contained Mail API parameters.

entries.title: End-User initiated profile merge, language placeholders & fixed stuff
entries.body:
New Stuff

  • When an end-user adds another email address to their profile, and that email address also belongs to another profile, Zendesk will now give the end-user the ability to merge the two profiles together once the end-user has verified they own the email address that was being added.
  • You are now able to use two new placeholders regarding user languages:
    1. {{ticket.requester.language}} will return the friendly name of a ticket requesters chosen language, i.e. "English", "Español"
    2. {{ticket.requester.locale}} will return their locale reference, i.e. "es", "fr", "en-US"
    This means you're now able to use our liquid template API to actually construct different notification based on an end-users language, and here's an example: http://pastie.org/private/ygvrg4mtrpfbpl4ho6o6q and you can learn more about liquid here: http://wiki.github.com/tobi/liquid/liquid-for-designers
  • Our Twitter integration received a big boost in functionality recently. You're now able to monitor search streams from within Zendesk, and turn certain tweets into "twickets". Find out more at http://www.zendesk.com/twitter-for-business

Fixed Stuff

  • The terms and conditions link on upgrade pages seemed to be linking to nowhere, we've now fixed that.
  • Zendesk dropbox has a few small problems rendering in some browsers.
  • JavaScript errors throughout Zendesk were resolved, including errors seen on category pages, table views, the clarizen widget and a few smaller areas. 
  • When the Zendesk dropbox has "topic suggestions" turned on, but no results were displayed to the end-user, it was displaying a soft error. This will no longer happen, and the end-user will not be aware of the missed step in the workflow.
  • Macros were not adding and removing tags appropriately. This was resolved earlier last week.
  • When a suspended ticket comes into Zendesk, we will now maintain the tags it came in with. Particularly useful for those tickets coming from the Zendesk dropbox.
  • Some inbound emails were causing problems for Zendesk due to their encoding, this was resolved.
  • When uploading files on the ticket interface, Zendesk will block the Ctrl+S (Submit) shortcut until the upload has finished.
  • When using the API to paginate results returned, Zendesk will now return a 404 if a page is requested, but the page does not exist or has no results.
  • Occasionally the URL Target was not constructing the GET URL correctly, this was resolved earlier in the week.

entries.title: Benchmarking & fixed stuff
entries.body:
All this great stuff will be rolled out by 4pm PST / 7pm EST / 12am GMT today. There will be no downtime. 

New Stuff

  • This week, we introduced benchmarking inside Zendesk. Don’t get too excited just yet, as we’re currently gathering data, which is where we could use your help.

    By answering a few simple questions, you can help us create (and keep improving) a benchmarking report that allows you to compare yourself with your peers. Top-notch companies do this all the time in an effort for continual improvement. But we’re going to do it for you.

    To get started, simply get your account owner to go to the account menu, and down to benchmarking.

Fixed Stuff

  • There were some issues, caused by some JavaScript problems, that caused a few related problems such as not being able to add CCs on tickets, just after our updates last week. This was noticed and fixed almost immediately after the deploy.
  • We also discovered very rare cases where our agent collision feature would trigger when it wasn’t supposed to. Due to the rarity of the problem, it took us a little while to track it down. But we’re now happy to say it should no longer be an issue.

entries.title: Topic API improvements & fixed stuff
entries.body:
New Stuff

  • You're now able to request the Zendesk API lists the attachments on a given forum topic. To do this, call a forum topic like you normally do with an added parameter.

    http://someaccount.zendesk.com/entries/23.xml?include[]=attachments

Fixed Stuff

entries.title: Top Secret Projects & Bug Fixes

New Stuff

Fixed Stuff

entries.title: Updates to Zendesk dropbox, user profiles and more

All this great stuff will be rolled out by 4:00pm PST / 7:00pm ET / 12:00am GMT. There will be no downtime. 

New Stuff
